newsitem.title: USA: Sterling Software to buy TI unit.
newsitem.headline: Sterling Software to buy TI unit.

text.p: Sterling Software Inc and Texas Instruments Inc said Monday they had signed a definitive agreement for Sterling to buy the Texas Instruments Software division for $165 million cash.
The deal includes the purchase of all Texas Instruments Software assets, including the stock of certain European subsidiaries, and various liabilities related to the business.
Texas Instruments Software's products are in involved in enterprise applications development.
For its fiscal year ended September 30, 1996, Sterling Software reported revenue of $439.2 million, including revenue of $109.8 million from its applications management business.
For the calendar year 1996, Texas Instruments Software had revenues of about $250 million, the companies said.
